tit.e: Suruga no kuni no miyatsuko (regional governor in ancient Japan)
tit.cmt: (government post) government postには違いないと思いますが、これだと中央官僚のようにも聞こえるので、regional governor in ancient Japan（古代日本の地域の統括者）としました。
tit.e: Suruga no kuni no miyatsuko (regional governor in ancient Japan)

sen.j: 珠流河国造（するがのくにみやつこ・するがこくぞう)は駿河国東部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Suruga no kuninomiyatsuko 珠流河国造 (also known as Suruga kokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled over the east part of Suruga Province.
Suruga no kuni no miyatsuko (珠流河国造), also known as Suruga kokuzo, was a kuni no miyatsuko ruled over the east part of Suruga Province in ancient Japan.
Suruga no kuni no miyatsuko (珠流河国造), also known as Suruga kokuzo, was a kuni no miyatsuko ruled over the east part of Suruga Province in ancient Japan.
It was also written as 駿河国造.
It was also written as 駿河国造.
It was also written as 駿河国造.

A Prince of Emperor Jinmu.

The Kanasashi clan (also known as the Kazashi clan.)
The Kanasashi clan (also known as the Kazashi clan.)
The Kanasashi clan (also known as the Kazashi clan.)

sen.j: 氏名の由来は欽明天皇の皇居磯城嶋金刺宮(奈良県桜井市)で、同天皇の舎人を出した。
sen.e: The name originated from the fact that the clan produced Toneri for Emperor Kinmei at the Palace of the Emperor, Shikishima no Kanasashi no miya (Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.)

This family name is originated from the fact that the clan sent Toneri people (valets) for Emperor Kinmei at the Shikishima no Kanasashi no miya (the palace for this emperor), existed in modern-day's Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 舎人は人なのでproduceではなく、宮に舎人を送ったことによる、としました。
sen.e: This family name is originated from the fact that the clan sent Toneri people (valets) for Emperor Kinmei at the Shikishima no Kanasashi no miya (the palace for this emperor), existed in modern-day's Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 現在の静岡県沼津市・御殿場市・裾野市・清水町 (静岡県)・長泉町・小山町。
sen.e: Present Numazu City, Gotenba City, Susono City, Shimizucho, Nagaizumicho, and Oyamacho in Shizuoka Prefecture.
Present Numazu City, Gotenba City, Susono City, Shimizucho, Nagaizumicho, and Oyamacho in Shizuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 候補としては桃澤神社(長泉町または沼津市)。
sen.e: Probably the Momosawa-jinja shrine (Nagaizumicho or Numazucho.)
